document_metadata.title: Mathematics Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

documents.introduction: In Grade 1, instructional time focuses on developing an understanding of addition, subtraction, and strategies for addition and subtraction within 20; developing an understanding of place value and whole number relationships, including grouping in tens and ones; developing an understanding of linear measurement and measuring lengths as iterating length units; and reasoning about attributes of and composing and decomposing geometric shapes.

strands.strand_description: Students develop number sense and understanding of place value.

standards.standard_statement: The student will utilize flexible counting strategies to determine and describe quantities up to 120.

knowledge_and_skills.objective_text: Count forward by ones to 120, starting at any number.
Count backward by ones from 30.
Count forward and backward by tens to 120 from a given multiple of ten.

standards.standard_statement: The student will identify, represent, compare, and order whole numbers up to 120.

knowledge_and_skills.objective_text: Identify the place and value of each digit in a two-digit or three-digit number.
examples: in 352, the 5 is in the tens place and has a value of 50

knowledge_and_skills.objective_text: Use place value understanding to compare and order whole numbers within 100.
Represent numbers using concrete objects, pictures, and numerals.

standards.standard_statement: The student will demonstrate an understanding of equality through the use of the equal sign.

knowledge_and_skills.objective_text: Recognize that the equal sign relates equivalent quantities.
Determine an unknown quantity in a whole number sentence.

document_metadata.title: Mathematics Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

documents.introduction: In Grade 5, instructional time focuses on developing fluency with addition and subtraction of fractions, and developing understanding of multiplication and division of fractions in limited cases; extending division to two-digit divisors; and developing understanding of operations with decimals to the hundredths place.

standards.standard_statement: The student will read, write, represent, compare, and order whole numbers through the millions period.

knowledge_and_skills.objective_text: Read and write whole numbers through millions in standard form, written form, and expanded form.
examples: written form: four million, three hundred twenty-eight thousand, five hundred seventy-six

knowledge_and_skills.objective_text: Compare and order whole numbers through millions.

standards.standard_statement: The student will estimate, determine, and verify sums and differences of fractions and mixed numbers, using multiple strategies.

knowledge_and_skills.objective_text: Estimate sums and differences of fractions and mixed numbers.
Determine sums and differences of fractions having like and unlike denominators.
sub_objectives: Limited to denominators of 12 or less

knowledge_and_skills.objective_text: Determine sums and differences of mixed numbers.
sub_objectives: Limited to denominators of 12 or less

document_metadata.title: Mathematics Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

documents.introduction: The Algebra 1 Standards of Learning emphasize the understanding of and proficiency with essential algebraic concepts and skills in a variety of contexts. Instruction should build on prior knowledge and provide students with opportunities to develop a deep understanding.

standards.standard_statement: The student will represent verbal quantitative situations algebraically and evaluate these expressions for given replacement values of the variables.

knowledge_and_skills.objective_text: Translate verbal quantitative situations into algebraic expressions and vice versa.
examples: 'five more than a number' becomes x + 5

knowledge_and_skills.objective_text: Evaluate algebraic expressions for given replacement values of the variables.

standards.standard_statement: The student will solve multi-step linear equations in one variable algebraically.

knowledge_and_skills.objective_text: Solve multi-step linear equations in one variable.
Confirm solutions to linear equations.
Identify equations with one solution, no solution, or infinitely many solutions.

standards.standard_statement: The student will investigate and explain characteristics of quadratic functions.

knowledge_and_skills.objective_text: Determine whether a relationship is a function given a set of data.
Identify characteristics of quadratic functions from graphs, tables, or equations.
Sketch the graph of a quadratic function.
